description: A file with .rhtml extension is a server side HTML file that contains Ruby code or scripts. The code is executed on the server using the Ruby on Rails running at the backend. For those who donâ€™t know about Ruby on Rails, it is a full-stack framework for developing web applications with backend databases based on the Model-View-Control pattern. Simply said, RHTML is a combination of HTML and Ruby where the power of Ruby scripting/programming is available to web developers using HTML tags.
